common_issues.title: Pieces OS High CPU Usage and Slow Performance
common_issues.description: Users report high CPU usage and slow performance, especially in web browsers and chat applications, after enabling Long Term Memory. Proposed solutions include updating Pieces OS and web browsers, restarting the LTM service, and moving Pieces folders to a different drive. The Pieces team is actively investigating and releasing patches to address these issues.

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
related_issues.text:
Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Turning on Long Term Memory has been slowing down my desktop computer, even before LTM-2. After updating today, it still happens. It's most noticeable when I use Slack and Discord, and disabling those apps on LTM doesn't work. Even after switching the Processing Mode to Cloud, as suggested by HRA42 on the Discord server, the lag still occurs. At some point, the total CPU usage went up by over 90%.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eaef0d65-b19b-41f0-bf8a-f143fa8d1e43)

My computer specs:
- CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i3-6300 CPU @ 3.80GHz
- RAM: DDR4 32 GB
- Graphics: GeForce GTX 950 2 GB

I'm yet to notice significant slowness on other programs, but if I'm getting a lot of lag on those chat apps, I can imagine I would get them too on something heavier like Visual Studio.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Problem:** High CPU usage, especially noticeable in web browsers like Microsoft Edge, after enabling Long Term Memory (LTM) 2 in Pieces OS 11.2.2.

**Key points raised:**

* Users reported high CPU usage after enabling LTM2.
* Discord and WebView2-based applications were particularly affected.
* The behavior appeared to be influenced by the number of browser tabs open.
* Some users reported temporary improvement after restarting the LTM service.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Pieces team released a hotfix and patch for 11.2.2.
* Users updated Microsoft Edge and WebView2 Runtime to 134.0.3124.51.
* Some users moved the necessary folders from user profile to another drive via symbolic links.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue appears to be resolved for users who updated Microsoft Edge and WebView2 Runtime.
* Other solutions provide temporary relief or workarounds.
* Pieces team continues to investigate the issue and plans to release further fixes.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue involved interaction between multiple applications and may have individual variations
* Users are encouraged to explore different solutions
* Pieces team suggests restarting LTM as a temporary fix until a permanent solution is available.

related_issues.title: Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
related_issues.text:
Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Current

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

A specific keyboard chain handler that was affected and incapacitated was zvirtualDesktop which has been in use for several years and behaves well with other handlers.

Eventually I was able to kill the Pieces OS instance but as I didn''t know what, if any, other effects there had been I restarted the machine. In logging in the MS new machine set of dialogs started, it evidently believed that this was the first run. I restarted again and so far the machine is working normally.

I uninstalled the Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop before the initial reboot. It's possible there was a dirty Registry on the first restart as it was a warm restart.

I do not believe that this product is suitable for public use without a considerable warning that there may be trouble ahead. As it is I don't think it's a product ready for market given the other points I've observed, (the inability to install it to other than the boot drive, the lack of information or control of where data is stored and so on.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @bpluly experienced several issues with the Pieces application, including slow Long Term Memory, failure to launch PiecesOS, and boot-up problems.
* The user provided details about the issues and expressed their disappointment.
* The user ultimately uninstalled the application due to a frustrating first experience.

**Problems Identified:**

* The application displayed performance and functionality issues, hindering the user experience.
* The initial setup and initial launch were problematic for the user.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces support responded with a triage message offering resources and a follow-up within 24 hours.
* They linked to related issues and resources that might be helpful.
* A request was sent for the user to participate in a debugging call to discuss their experience and troubleshoot the problems.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains open, pending a response from the user regarding the call invitation.
* The Pieces support team is awaiting further engagement to investigate and resolve the identified issues. 

**Additional Notes:**

* This summary is based on the provided conversation excerpt.
* The overall outcome of the issue resolution remains uncertain as it depends on further interaction and troubleshooting.

related_issues.title: Pieces desktop application is very slow/laggy, not generating any response in copilot chat.
related_issues.text:
Pieces desktop application is very slow/laggy, not generating any response in copilot chat.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.0.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces desktop application is working very much slow after latest update, takes very much time to give any response. Even after doing a hard reset active runtime, it just do not work. 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* Users reported significant slowdown in Copilot response times after the release of Pieces OS 10.0.2 & Pieces Desktop 3.0.2.
* The issue appeared to be intermittent and not consistent for all users.
* The problem was attributed to a bug in the Copilot experience related to clicking "Hard-Reset Active Runtime".
* A fix was implemented and released in a patch for Pieces OS 10.0.2 & Pieces Desktop 3.0.2.

**Problems Identified:**

* Copilot responses were significantly slower for some users.
* The issue was not consistent and affected some users more than others.
* The underlying cause was a bug in the Copilot experience related to the "Hard-Reset Active Runtime" feature.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* A bug fix was implemented and released in a patch for Pieces OS 10.0.2 & Pieces Desktop 3.0.2.
* The fix addressed the issue with the "Hard-Reset Active Runtime" feature.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue appears to be resolved for most users with the latest updates to Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop.
* Some users continued to experience slow response times after the initial fix, with the issue resurfacing after the release of Pieces OS 10.0.3 and Desktop 3.0.2.
* This issue was addressed by further performance improvements released in Desktop app version 3.1.0.

**Additional Notes:**

* As of November 2023, the reported issues are believed to be resolved.
* However, new issues may arise in subsequent updates, and users are encouraged to report any problems they encounter.

I hope this summary is helpful! Please let me know if you have any other questions.

common_issues.title: Copilot vague responses and slow performance
common_issues.description: Users report Copilot providing vague responses instead of actionable solutions, often claiming it's examining data. This issue appears related to specific interactions or exceeding a certain number of requests. Additionally, users experience slow performance and lag, particularly after updates. Solutions include switching to Gemini 2.0 Flash LLM, restarting Pieces OS, or updating to the latest version with bug fixes.

related_issues.title: Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
related_issues.text:
Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**The Bug**
The chat assistant will respond claiming that it's working on a solution and will get back to you at a later date. 

**Expected Behaviour**
Get an actionable response with some suggested action/code.

**Details**
Most recent example of this kind of response ("_" is not part of the response just a redaction):

> "I'll carefully examine the data flow related to _, _, _, _, and _  to see if any inconsistencies could lead to bugs. Please give me a few minutes to review the code thoroughly with this specific focus in mind. I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible."

This has happened in three different conversations. I first noticed the behaviour this month, so not before updates preceding March. I promise I'm not trying to be lazy on this one, it's difficult to offer reproduction steps.

I use Claude 3.5 more than any option regularly.

The last conversation where this happened:

- I loaded 15 files into the context menu
- I sent 22 requests (and received 22 responses where it happened on the 22nd response)

I'll update this issue if there's anything I can do to make the reproduction more narrow.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points:**

* User `seantiz` reported a bug where the copilot wasn't responding properly to their questions after sending 11 requests.
* The bug was not reproducible by the support team.
* The issue was likely fixed by switching to the Gemini 2.0 Flash LLM.

**Problem identified:**

The copilot was malfunctioning and not responding to user prompts after a certain number of requests. 

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Switching to the Gemini 2.0 Flash LLM.

**Outcome:**

The bug appears to be fixed with the new LLM. The issue will be monitored and reopened if the problem persists.

"Secret Message" Example doesn't work properly
### Checked for Existing Issues?

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When using LTM-2 to test the secret message example:
https://pieces.app/magic-moments/ltm

I got a strange response from the LLM:
Claude 3.5:
First Try:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1962a3e4-8b02-4d3f-bc8c-4bdd72c80aa6)
2. try: (waited longer on the website)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cd71c5c1-d5d5-4449-acd5-e070fb244fa9)

Gemini 2.0 Flash did fail completely:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/50735f7a-28a1-4563-b490-e10c271eca23)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users @hra42, @joelash, and @bartonfriedland encountered the "running in basic mode due to device constraints" error message on M3 MacBooks.
* This message appeared in the menu item and prevented the proper functioning of secret messages and LTM engine updates.
* @bartonfriedland also noticed an "unknown origin" element with version 1.0.10 in the telemetry browser.

**Problems Identified:**

* The bug caused PiecesOS to enter "basic mode" accidentally on M3 MacBooks, even though they support vector search.
* This mode disabled certain features, including secret messages and LTM engine updates.
* The cause of the "unknown origin" element was unclear.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @mark-at-pieces suggested restarting PiecesOS as a temporary fix.
* A permanent fix for the "basic mode" issue was promised for the next PiecesOS version.
* Investigating the "unknown origin" element was deferred.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The "basic mode" issue will be fixed in the next PiecesOS update.
* Users experiencing the issue can use the temporary fix of restarting PiecesOS.
* The root cause and solution for the "unknown origin" element are pending further investigation.

**Additional Notes:**

* The "Long Term Memory engine makes piecesOs loop reload" issue (#644) might be related.
* The issue was automatically routed to the relevant Pieces team member.
* Resources like existing issues, documentation, and YouTube channel were shared for the user's reference.
* @mark-at-pieces offered to elaborate on "basic mode" if desired.

**Key points:**

* The issue started after a recent update.
* MoyinShabi is unable to launch the app.
* No health check notifications were received.
* The issue seems to be related to the desktop app's database.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Log files were requested and analyzed.
* The "com.pieces.pfd" folder was replaced with a repaired version.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue appears to be complex and requires further investigation.
* The user is actively engaged in troubleshooting with the Pieces team.
* The issue is being treated with urgency.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Installation and Feature Issues
common_issues.description: Users report various issues with Pieces OS, including installation failures due to missing dependencies, high CPU usage leading to system unresponsiveness, and difficulties enabling the Long Term Memory (LTM) feature. Proposed solutions involve adding missing dependencies to the installation package, optimizing resource management, and ensuring proper permissions for LTM activation.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Issue:** Ollama installation fails due to missing `curl` in the Pieces-OS snap sandbox.

**Key Points:**

- The issue was first reported in December 2024 with the `curl` program being absent in the Pieces-OS snap sandbox environment.
- Installing Ollama manually didn't resolve the problem because the sandbox restricts access to external programs.

**Problems Identified:**

- Ollama installation fails due to missing `curl`.
- This issue impacts both downloading and inference of local LLM models.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

- Adding `curl` to the Pieces-OS snap definition file.
- Implementing a solution that allows Ollama to run within the sandbox environment.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

- The issue has been acknowledged by the Pieces team and a fix is currently under development.
- As of March 2025, the fix is not yet available. 

**Additional Information:**

- Users are awaiting the fix, expressing concerns about data privacy when using cloud LLMs.
- The issue remains open as of March 2025.

related_issues.title: Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
related_issues.text:
Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Current

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

A specific keyboard chain handler that was affected and incapacitated was zvirtualDesktop which has been in use for several years and behaves well with other handlers.

Eventually I was able to kill the Pieces OS instance but as I didn''t know what, if any, other effects there had been I restarted the machine. In logging in the MS new machine set of dialogs started, it evidently believed that this was the first run. I restarted again and so far the machine is working normally.

I uninstalled the Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop before the initial reboot. It's possible there was a dirty Registry on the first restart as it was a warm restart.

I do not believe that this product is suitable for public use without a considerable warning that there may be trouble ahead. As it is I don't think it's a product ready for market given the other points I've observed, (the inability to install it to other than the boot drive, the lack of information or control of where data is stored and so on.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @bpluly experienced several issues with the Pieces application, including slow Long Term Memory, failure to launch PiecesOS, and boot-up problems.
* The user provided details about the issues and expressed their disappointment.
* The user ultimately uninstalled the application due to a frustrating first experience.

**Problems Identified:**

* The application displayed performance and functionality issues, hindering the user experience.
* The initial setup and initial launch were problematic for the user.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces support responded with a triage message offering resources and a follow-up within 24 hours.
* They linked to related issues and resources that might be helpful.
* A request was sent for the user to participate in a debugging call to discuss their experience and troubleshoot the problems.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains open, pending a response from the user regarding the call invitation.
* The Pieces support team is awaiting further engagement to investigate and resolve the identified issues. 

**Additional Notes:**

* This summary is based on the provided conversation excerpt.
* The overall outcome of the issue resolution remains uncertain as it depends on further interaction and troubleshooting.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS unable to enable LTM
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS unable to enable LTM
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When attempting to enable the LTM engine, either in the Pieces desktop app by clicking "Allow" for "Periodic Application Indexing" or in the Pieces OS directly, clicking "Enable Long Term Memory Engine", nothing happens. Even after multiple Pieces OS restarts and a clean install. 

Tailed the local log while doing both operations, only clicking "Enable Long Term Memory Engine" resulted in logs:
```
[D]  Sentry Error Event: 351d4b13dbae46589cabd593569f9049
```

[piecesOS-03162025log.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19275571/piecesOS-03162025log.txt)
Also confirmed permissions were granted appropriately:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2fa7002e-0c18-46fe-abaf-288350a90b1b)

Loop in Detail:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c964a15d-2307-4d83-a9f8-0d82d7b608b8

I can reproduce quickly and easily if you need more details/fresh logs!
## GitHub Issue Summary: LTM Activation Issue

**Key Points:**

* User (@kwburgess) is unable to activate the Long Term Memory (LTM) feature in PiecesOS.
* The issue appears to be related to permissioning on the user's local machine.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS may not have the necessary permissions for screen & system recording and accessibility.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @mark-at-pieces suggests confirming permission settings and provides images for reference.
* An alternative solution is offered: scheduling a real-time meeting via the provided calendar link.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is still open. It's unclear whether the user has confirmed the permission settings or scheduled a meeting. 

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation also includes links to related issues and helpful resources.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving high-frequency issues:** Focus on addressing the "Pieces OS High CPU Usage and Slow Performance", "Copilot vague responses and slow performance", "Pieces Desktop and OS Installation and Launch Issues", "Pieces Desktop App Performance Issues", and "Pieces OS Installation and Feature Issues" as they represent the bulk of support tickets.

**Investigate and address root causes:**  For recurring issues like slow performance and installation problems, allocate resources to identify and fix the underlying causes rather than just addressing symptoms.

**Improve installation and launch experience:** Given the prevalence of installation and launch issues, dedicate resources to streamline the process, potentially including dependency checks and clearer error messaging.

**Enhance Copilot performance and response quality:** Address concerns about Copilot's speed and the vagueness of its responses. This might involve optimizing its algorithms or providing clearer guidance on its capabilities.

**Review LTM implementation:** Given the performance issues and activation problems related to Long Term Memory, conduct a thorough review of its implementation to improve resource management and user experience.
**Proactively monitor system performance:** Implement monitoring tools to detect performance issues in real-time, allowing for quicker identification and resolution of problems like high CPU usage.
**Improve communication about known issues:**  Maintain a clear and updated list of known issues to keep users informed and reduce support tickets related to already identified problems.
**Develop more comprehensive troubleshooting resources:** Create detailed troubleshooting guides and FAQs to empower users to resolve common issues independently.
**Consider user feedback:** Analyze support tickets and user feedback for patterns and suggestions that can inform product improvements and support strategies.
**Offer personalized support options:** For complex issues, provide options for personalized support, such as debugging calls, to ensure effective resolution and improve user satisfaction.
